channel.title: Health and Social Care Committee — News

item.title: Govt risks missing golden opportunity to transform mental health services, Health Committee says
item.description: A new Health and Social Care Committee report urges the Government not to miss a golden opportunity to dramatically improve England’s mental health services.

item.title: Committee publishes Independent Expert Panel’s report on palliative care services in England
item.description: The Independent Expert Panel (IEP), commissioned by the Health and Social Care Committee, has produced a report on England’s palliative and end of life care services.

item.title: Sexual health services undervalued and under-resourced after a decade of being overlooked
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee has written a letter to the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) with recommendations for strengthening England’s sexual health and reproductive services.

item.title: Black women still ignored in maternity care, say MPs
item.description: Health and Social Care Committee calls for urgent action to address culture, workforce shortages, data collection and leadership

item.title: Autism and ADHD diagnostic pathways for children and young people: MPs write to DHSC with recommendations
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee has today written to the Health Minister Stephen Kinnock, on the subject of the autism and ADHD diagnostic pathways for children and young people, following the Committee’s evidence session on the subject on 25 June.

item.title: How can the Government tackle the obesity epidemic? MPs’ new inquiry to cover access to nutritious food and weight management medications
item.description: Prevention and treatment of obesity will be the focus of a new inquiry by Parliament’s Health and Social Care Committee.

item.title: Government response: Adult social care reform and the cost of inaction
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee has today (Wednesday 16 July) written to the Secretary of State, Wes Streeting, following the Government’s publication of its response to the Committee’s ‘Adult Social Care Reform: the cost of inaction’ report.

item.title: Health and Social Care Secretary to face MPs’ questions on the 10 Year Health Plan
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee will question the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, the Rt Hon Wes Streeting, in an evidence session at 2pm on Monday 14 July.

item.title: New select committee inquiry into healthy ageing
item.description: The Health and Social Care Select Committee has launched a new inquiry into the role of physical activity in improving the health and wellbeing of older people.

item.title: Gambling-related harms: MPs call on Government to act
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee have written to the Department of Health and Social Care, setting out measures they want the Government to take in order to better protect people from the possible harms from gambling.

item.title: Andrea Leadsom and Michael Marmot to be questioned by MPs on the first 1000 days of life
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee will hold the first evidence session of its inquiry into the first 1000 days of life at 9.30am on Wednesday 7 May.

item.title: Casey Commission reforms doomed to fail, unless Government measures true cost of inaction on social care, say MPs
item.description: Reporting on the problems of England’s social care sector, MPs say that too much emphasis is put on the cost of change and not enough consideration is given to the human and financial cost of inaction.

item.title: Committee to explore how local government and the third sector address the wider social needs of people with severe mental illness
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee will hold the third session of its community mental health services inquiry, at 9.30am on Wednesday 23 April.

item.title: Secretary of State Wes Streeting to face questions on NHS England reorganisation
item.description: On Tuesday 8 April, MPs will question the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care on the Government's plan to abolish NHS England (NHSE) and merge it with the Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC).

item.title: Health and Social Care Committee to hear evidence on gambling-related harms
item.description: The Health and Social Care Select Committee will examine the current gambling landscape and the potential for harms caused by developments in gambling products in a one-off oral evidence session at 9.30am on Wednesday 2 April.

item.title: NHS England reorganisation: senior sector figures share their views with MPs
item.description: The Health and Social Care Select Committee will question senior figures from across the health sector on their views on the Government’s plans to abolish NHS England and merge it with the Department of Health and Social Care, in an evidence session at 9.30am on Wednesday 26 March.

item.title: Committee announces new inquiry on First 1000 Days of Life
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee is today (Friday 21 March) launching a new inquiry on the first 1000 days of life, the period from a child’s conception to age two - widely recognised as a critical period for development which fundamentally shapes long-term health, well-being, and life outcomes.

item.title: Unpaid carers among witnesses giving evidence to MPs this week
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee will hold the final evidence session of its inquiry into the cost of inaction on adult social care reform, at 9.30am on Wednesday 19 March.

item.title: MPs continue inquiry into community mental health services
item.description: The Health and Social Care Committee will next week take evidence from lived experience witnesses, health professionals and senior officials from NHS Trusts and Integrated Care Boards, as it continues its inquiry examining the provision of community mental health services (CMHS) for adults with severe mental health needs.

item.title: Health and Social Care Committee appoints palliative care specialists to its Independent Expert Panel
